item.dc:creator: Fr0z3n
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:
Fr0z3n:

As user696 said, in console, set mat_dxlevel 90. This should work for you. Sorry about this.

And as I said previously, that didn’t help. What did eventually help was setting HDR level to 2, and restarting the game several times. However, that doesn’t seem to stick permanently, as the game will occasionally bump the HDR level back to 0.

We’re looking into the issue now. Basically, the entire game is compiled as HDR only, not LDR, thus the LDR issue. (This is intentional)

item.title: Countdown on the BM website
item.dc:creator: Crawfish
item.description:
Bladebitch:

OMG, the forum keeps disappering. So much hype!

Crypt:

Exactly, people who refuse that something should be sold on account of nothing more than not wanting to spend money, believing that everything should be free. They can try to justify their claims in any way, but it all comes down to not wanting to spend money. They can settle for the free version, or fuck 'em. It’s really not worth getting up in arms about. As a reasonable person, I’ve payed and will enjoy their hard work, because dammit, the levels of joy this will bring me…

Screw them. I’ve played it for a short while now and the amount of new things, big and small, is awesome. I’m not going to let anyone ruin this.
Well worth the money. Realized when I payed though that I’m actually giving money to my own brother who is one of the devs…

Have you checked to see if the performance options have been updated, like was spoiler in the “ask the devs” thread? Multicore rendering and such in the adv. video options?

Read full topic

So many people on steam complaining about how it costs money… You’d think they would’ve gotten the memo by now, but no.

item.dc:creator: ev1te
item.description:
CPU:
NoriMori:

Wow, how 'bout that server load. XD

All that build-up for early access, multiplayer, no Xen, and no Xen release date. >< I always knew it might turn out that way, but I still don’t get why they had to do it in a way that was guaranteed to get people’s hopes up. :<

Also: “Black Mesa will be $19.99 USD during the Early Access phase.” …And yet it’s $21.99. >.> Still plan to get it, just thought that was kinda weird…

I don’t understand what you’re seeing. I got it for $19.99

I just bought it and here it is $22.40 (Sweden).

Maybe different VAT in different countries? But I can not see any specification on the receipt for the VAT though so it’s hard to confirm…

By the way what has been updated in this version compared to the original, released more than 2.5 years ago (except adding multiplayer support)? Can not find a changelog anywhere…
